posts.title: How to Install Visual Studio Code on Windows
posts.content:
Introduction

Visual Studio Code (or simply VS Code) is a tool used primarily by programmers to develop software systems. This tool is free, open source, and can be installed in popular Operating Systems such as Windows, Linux, and MacOS. If you would like to know more about it, please access their website.

Downloading

Access https://code.visualstudio.com/Download, click on "Windows".

Your browser will download a .exe file. Double-click to start the installer.

Installing

The first screen just check "I accept the agreement" and then "Next".

Keep everything as it is and press "Next".

Keep everything as it is and press "Next".

Check the following options and then press "Next".

Keep everything as it is and press "Next".

The installation process will take a few seconds. Just wait.

Keep everything as it is and press "Next".

Congratulations. You have installed VS Code on your machine. Just select your preferred theme (dark or light) and that's it. Close the "Welcome" tab.

The image below shows that your VS Code is up and running.

References

  • https://code.visualstudio.com
  • https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/setup/windows

posts.title: How to Install Nginx on MacOS
posts.content:
Introduction

Nginx (pronounced "engine x") is a web server that can also be used as a reverse proxy, load balancer, mail proxy and HTTP cache. However, a large fraction of web servers use Nginx, often as a load balancer.

Installing

To install it on MacOS, we are going to use homebrew. If you don't have it installed on your computer, please follow this tutorial.

If you have homebrew installed, open the terminal and type:

brew install nginx

The default port will be set to 8080. Also, you don't need to type sudo to run it.

Just press "allow" if the following screen pops up.

Running

brew services start nginx

Stopping

Type the following command to stop nginx on your computer

brew services stop nginx

Configuring

Nginx uses configuration files to run. For this installation, nginx will load all files in /opt/homebrew/etc/nginx/servers/.

If you would like to use Nginx as a load balancer, create a new file at /opt/homebrew/etc/nginx/servers/. For instance, create a mysite.com file as the image below

The content should be:

upstream my_http_servers {
    server localhost:3000;      # server1 listens to port 3000
    server localhost:3001;      # server2 listens to port 3001
    server localhost:3002;      # server3 listens to port 3002
}

server {
    listen 80;
    server_name mysite.com www.mysite.com;

    location / {
        proxy_pass         http://my_http_servers;
    }
}

Save the file, stop and start again Nginx.

posts.title: How to Open Node.js Project
posts.content:
Introduction

First, you have to open the project on Visual Studio Code (VS Code). You should search for the "File" menu and then "Open Folderâ€¦". Please don't select "Open.." This will open a single file. You should open the entire project (entire folder).

Select the project folder and then press "Open".

If everything goes well, you should be able to see on VS Code the entire folder

Go back to the menu bar, search for "View" and then click on "Terminal".

This will open a built-in terminal on VS Code. The good thing is that the terminal is opened in the project folder. That is, you don't need to navigate to that folder. You are ready to launch your project.

Just type node server.js. You should be able now to see your project running in the browser.

posts.title: How to Install PostgreSQL on Windows
posts.content:
Downloading

Access the download page and select "Windows".

Click on "Download the installer".

Finally, click on "Windows x86-64".

The download should start automatically. Otherwise, press "Click here".

If everything goes well, you should have the installer located in the "Downloads" folder on your Windows. Just double-click on it to initiate the installation process.

Installing

Just press "Yes" to confirm you would like to install PostgreSQL.

Just click on "Next".

Keep everything as it is. Just click on "Next".

Keep everything as it is. Just click on "Next".

Keep everything as it is. Just click on "Next".

Type the password for your database. For now, you can just type postgres in both text fields. In production, never use this password. Choose a strong one. After that, click on "Next".

Keep the port information as it is. Click on "next".

Keep the location as it is. Click on "next".

A pre-installation summary will show up to confirm all your selections. Just press on "Next".

Finally, press on "Next".

The installation process will get started. Wait a few minutes to get it done.

Heads up! Uncheck this option. We don't need it for now. Click on "Finish".

Done. The entire process should be completed and you have installed both PostgreSQL and pgAdmin 4 in the same process.

If you would like to install only the pgAdmin 4, I recommend you to follow this tutorial.

posts.title: How to Install pgAdmin 4 on Windows
posts.content:
Downloading

Access the download page and select "Windows".

For now, you just need to install the latest version (at this time v8.5). If you are reading this post in the future, just select the latest version available. For now, just click "pgAdmin 4 v8.5".

Click on the .exe file to download it.

If everything goes well, you should have the installer located in the "Downloads" folder on your Windows. Just double-click on it to initiate the installation process.

Installing

The first popup will ask you if you would like to install pgAdmin for all users on your computer or just for you. For now, just install it for you by clicking on "Install for me only (recommended)". If you have a computer borrowed from the university, this is the only option for you, since you can install it without asking ITS to set up it for you.

Just click "Next".

Accept the agreement by selecting "I accept the agreement" and then clicking on "Next".

In the next screen, you should not change anything. Just click "Next".

Again, please do not change anything. Just click "Next".

Finally, press "Install".

Please wait for the installation process to be done.

Done. You have successfully installed pgAdmin 4 on your computer. It is time to launch it.

Opening

Open the menu on your Windows and search for "pgAdmin". Click to open it.

Congratulations! You have installed pgAdmin on your Windows.

posts.title: How to Install Node.js
posts.content:
Introduction

MacOS

Access the Node.js's download website and press "Download".

This will download a .pkg file. Double-click on it and then wait for the window to open.

Just press "Enter" to go to the next screen.

Just press "Continue" to go to the next screen.

Confirm you accept the terms of use.

Finally, press "Install". It will take some seconds to install it.

When the installation process is over, MacOS will ask you the move the .pkg to the trash. Just press "Move to Trash".

Congratulations! You have installed Node.js on your computer. If you would like to make sure the installation went well, just open the terminal and type node --version.
